revised_title: Horseradish Peroxidase Study of Motorneuron Pools in Axolotl Limbs
tldr: This study investigates motorneuron pools in the axolotl's forelimb and hindlimb musculature using horseradish peroxidase as a retrograde neuronal tracer. The research characterizes motorneuron pools by four criteria: position in the rostrocaudal axis, median position, number of labeled cells, and position in the transverse plane of the spinal cord. The findings provide a map to assay neuromuscular specificity in experiments on limb regeneration in axolotls.
